fields.name: The Wilf Ward Family Trust
fields.para_1: In an effort to bring unity to an organisation that had acted fairly independently all across Yorkshire, a brand restructure was implemented.
fields.para_2: This required the recreation of effective brand guidelines, including fun droplet characters that would bridge the gap between supported individuals and their support workers.
fields.para_3: A greater focus on their Yorkshire roots was important to the team, so a new marketing strategy was created that promoted this.
fields.keywords: Branding, Marketing, Graphic Design, Web Design

fields.name: Tim and Tom on the Radio
fields.para_1: Hosts of local Scarborough radio show “Tim & Tom on the Radio” wanted to branch out into a limited range of merchandise, including t-shirts and mugs that could be given out as competition prizes on their show.
fields.para_2: A reversable design that harked back to their love of playing cards was decided upon.

fields.name: North of the Wall
fields.para_1: Ahead of the release of their first album, popular indie band “North of the Wall” required a striking logo and album artwork.
fields.para_2: Fans of the geometric art style, the band settled on a repurposed promotional photo, which was used in all other material required for their launch.

fields.name: Tea with the Morale Queen
fields.para_1: Up and coming Stand up Comedian, Milly Armstrong-Clark brings the laughs on stage, and in her weekly podcast, “Tea With The Morale Queen.”
fields.para_2: Milly wanted a brand that stood out while holding onto her quirky, tea-loving aesthetic. Designs for her podcast and stand up shows were created, along with a personal website.

fields.name: Confidence for Breakfast
fields.para_1: Comedian Mel Judson branched out into the world of podcasting with her debut show, “Confidence for Breakfast.”
fields.para_2: For this project, she required a logo and brand styling that could be used across her marketing strategies that portrayed a strong and confident message.

fields.name: Coastcall Independent Living Team
fields.para_1: In an effort to increase understanding of the service and increase service users, a soft reboot of the brand was implemented.
fields.para_2: This covered everything from leaflet and brochure creation to social media and website launch.
fields.para_3: Market research was carried out, and a customer survey was conducted to see where areas of the service promotion could be improved.
fields.keywords: Branding, Marketing, Graphic Design, Web Design

fields.name: The Beach Hut Beer
fields.para_1: As part of an expansion into the hospitality industry, local community cleanup project The Beach wanted a comemorative beer bottle created.
fields.para_2: This project was created in conjunction with famed theatre, the Stephen Joseph Theatre, with whom the beverage would be served at.
fields.para_3: The Beach Hut Beer would celebrate the beloved Scarborough chalets, while also mimicking the style of other craft beers sold in the theatre.

fields.name: Eye of the Beholder
fields.para_1: Starting life as a concept piece for North of the Wall’s followup album, this piece of art transformed into a design with its own unique story.
fields.para_2: Prints of this design have sold all around the world, and have formed the basis for tattoos.

fields.name: The James Stone Thriller Series
fields.para_1: In his spare time, Rob is a Self-Published Author with 10 books to his name, each receiving 5-star reviews on Amazon.
fields.para_2: For these books, he undertook extensive research on necessary subjects, and on marketing opposition, critically reviewed and edited his work, created market-ready covers that matched industry standards, built an author website, and developed detailed marketing strategies.
fields.para_3: Each of these projects required self-discipline, evaluation, and patience in order to meet the high standards he sets for himself.
fields.keywords: Branding, Marketing, Graphic Design, Web Design

fields.name: Geometric  Panorama Prints
fields.para_1: Starting off as a passion project, these geometric panoramic designs quickly took on a life of their own as intrest soared.
fields.para_2: Taking upwards of 40 hours per piece, these designs have been sold across Yorkshire at fares and markets, and a renowned art gallery in Whitby.
fields.para_3: Prints can now be purchased through the RCD store

fields.name: Geometric Animal Prints
fields.para_1: Expanding upon the geometric panoramas, a range of animal head designs were created. These sold primarily on postcards and t-shirts, and have been bought by customers all across the world.
fields.para_2: Prints can now be purchased through the RCD store

fields.name: Geometric Commissions
fields.para_1: This stunning art style has proved highly popular with customers looking to turn their treasured memories into works of art.
fields.para_2: From portaits of beloved animals to wedding gifts, there is no image that would not suit the geometric style.
fields.para_3: Commissions can be purchased through the RCD store
